availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Porter (Hopkins co. and christian County, farmer and Physician)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and physician. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Porter and Permelia F. Porter. Married to Mary Prince Porter in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on December 7, 1853. Father of A. Porter and L. Porter. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eleven persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Physician in Christian County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Christian County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 159B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 733.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 551.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 257A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages.
